intro: Ranunculus acris var. pyrenaeus, commonly known as the Pyrenean buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Iberian Peninsula. It features palmately divided, bright yellow flowers with numerous stamens, typically blooming in early spring. The plant has a basal rosette of hairy, lanceolate leaves that are often tinged with reddish hues. It thrives in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in alpine meadows and rocky habitats. This variety is distinguished by its compact growth habit and is considered a rare and endemic species within its range.
